lead_paragraph: The Marlins’ rise to the top of the N.L. East coincides with Andrew Miller’s trading walks for strikeouts. Miller, below, struck out 18 and walked 13 in compiling a 9.12 E.R.A. over his first six starts. In four starts since, he is 3-1 with a 1.44 E.R.A., striking out 26 and walking 7. The Mets, who ripped Miller for five runs in his first start, will face the new Miller this week.
